citation.article-title: Reclassification of Eubacterium formicigenerans Holdeman and Moore 1974 as Dorea formicigenerans gen. nov., comb. nov., and description of Dorea longicatena sp. nov., isolated from human faeces.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Dorea (Do.re'a. N.L. gen. n. Dorea of Joel Dor√©, in honour of the French microbiologist, in recognition of his many contributions to gut microbiology)
Obligately anaerobic and catalase- and oxidase-negative.
Glucose and some other sugars are fermented.
The major end-products of glucose metabolism are ethanol, formate, acetate, H2 and CO2 ; lactate may or may not be formed but butyrate is not produced.
Gelatin and starch are not hydrolysed.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
The G+C content of the DNA is 40-45.6 mol%.
The type species of the genus is Dorea formicigenerans (Holdeman and Moore 1974).
